tn.text: "In year two" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal|Ordinal Numbers]])
"Nebuchadnezzar had dreams"
Here "mind" refers to his thoughts. AT: "His thoughts disturbed him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy|Metonymy]])
His troubled thoughts prevented him from sleeping. AT: "so that he could not sleep"

tn.ref: Then the king summoned the magicians
tn.text: "Then the king called the magicians"
"people who had died"
"they came into the palace"
"stood in front of"
Here "mind" refers to the king himself. AT: "I am anxious" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
"troubled"
This is the language that people in Babylon spoke. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
The men probably said this to show the king that they were loyal to him. AT: "King, we hope you will live forever!"
The men called themselves the king's servants to show him respect.
Here the word "we" refers to the men that the king is speaking to and does not include the king. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_exclusive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "I have already decided what to do about this matter" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: your bodies will be torn apart and your houses made into rubbish heaps
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will command my soldiers to tear your bodies apart and to make your houses into rubbish heaps" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: you will receive gifts from me
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will give you gifts" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The wise men addressed the king in the third person as a sign of respect. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])

tn.ref: you see how firm my decision is about this
tn.text: A decision that will not be changed is spoken of as something firm. AT: "you see that I will not change my decision about this" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: there is only one sentence for you
tn.text: "there is only one punishment for you"
These two words mean approximately the same thing and emphasize that these are "lies intended to deceive." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
These two words mean basically the same thing and emphasize the greatness of the king's power. AT: "most powerful" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: there is no one who can tell it to the king except the gods
tn.text: This is stated in negative form for emphasis. It can be stated in positive form. AT: "only the gods can tell this to the king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
These words mean basically the same thing and emphasize the intensity of his anger. AT: "incredibly angry" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
"all the men in Babylon"
The decree is spoken of as if it was alive and able to go out by itself. AT: "So the king issued a command" or "So the king gave a command" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: all those who were known for their wisdom were to be put to death
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the soldiers were to kill all of the men who were known for their wisdom" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: so they could be put to death
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "in order to kill them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
These two words mean basically the same thing and emphasize the greatness of his prudence. AT: "caution and careful judgment" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
This is the name of the king's commander. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is a group of men whose job is to protect the king.
"who the king had sent out to kill"
Daniel probably went to the palace. AT: "Daniel went to the palace" or "Daniel went to talk with the king" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: requested an appointment with the king
tn.text: "asked for a set time to meet with the king"
This is referring to Daniel's house.
"about the king's decree"

tn.ref: He urged them to seek mercy
tn.text: "He begged them to pray for mercy"

tn.ref: so that he and they might not be killed
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "so that the king would not kill them" or "so that the king's bodyguard would not kill them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: That night the mystery was revealed
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "That night God revealed the mystery" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is referring to the king's dream and its meaning.
Here "name" refers to God himself. AT: "Praise God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
These verses are also part of Daniel's prayer.
"he takes away kings' authority to rule"
Here being on the "throne" refers to ruling over a kingdom. AT: "makes new kings rule over their kingdoms" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"the light comes from where God is"
This verse is also part of Daniel's prayer. He stops addressing God in the third person and switches to the more personal second person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])

tn.ref: made known to me what we requested from you
tn.text: "told me what my friends and I asked you to tell us" (UDB)

tn.ref: made known to us the matter that concerns the king
tn.text: "told us what the king wants to know"
This is the name of the king's commander. See how you translated this name in [[:en:bible:notes:dan:02:14|2:14]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"the wise men"
This was the name the Babylonians gave to Daniel. See how you translated this name in [[:en:bible:notes:dan:01:06|1:7]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: The mystery that the king has asked about ... not by astrologers
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Those who have wisdom, those who claim to speak with the dead, magicians, and astrologers cannot reveal the mystery about which the king has asked" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: The mystery that the king has asked about
tn.text: This phrase refers to the king's dream.
Daniel continues talking to the king.
This phrase refers to God. AT: "God, who reveals mysteries" or "God, who makes mysteries known" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: this mystery was not revealed to me
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God did not reveal this mystery to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: This mystery was revealed to me so that you
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "He revealed the mystery to me so that you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: know the thoughts deep within you
tn.text: This phrase is using the word "you" referring to the person's mind. AT: "know the thoughts deep inside your mind" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Daniel continues talking to the king.
"was of fine gold" or "was fine gold"

tn.ref: were made partly of iron and partly of clay
tn.text: "were partly of iron and partly of clay" or "were partly iron and partly clay"
Daniel continues talking to the king.

tn.ref: a stone was cut out, although not by human hands, and it
tn.text: This can be stated in active form if it is divided into two sentences. AT: "someone cut a stone from a mountain, but it was not a human who cut it. The stone" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: like the chaff of the threshing floors in the summer
tn.text: This phrase is comparing the pieces of the statue to small and light things which could be blown away by the wind. AT: "like dry pieces of grass blowing away in the wind" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: there was no trace of them left
tn.text: This can be stated in positive form. AT: "they were completely gone" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
"spread over the whole earth"
Daniel continues talking to the king.

tn.ref: Now we will tell the king
tn.text: Here "we" refers only to Daniel. He may have used to plural form in humility to avoid taking credit for knowing the meaning of the dream that God had revealed to him. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_pronouns]])
"the most important king" or "a king who rules over other kings" (UDB)
These words mean basically the same thing. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: He has given into your hand the place
tn.text: Here "hand" refers to control. AT: "He has given you control over the place" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: the place where the human beings live
tn.text: The place is used to represent the people who live there. AT: "the people of the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: He has given over the animals ... into your hand
tn.text: Here "hand" refers to control. AT: "He has given you control over the animals of the fields and the birds of the heavens" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "heavens" is used in the sense of "skies."

tn.ref: You are the statue's head of gold
tn.text: In the king's dream the statue's head represents the king. AT: "The golden head symbolizes you" or "The golden head is a symbol of you and your power" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_symlanguage]])
Daniel continues talking to the king.

In the king's dream his kingdom is gold so an inferior kingdom would be silver. AT: "another kingdom, which is of silver, will arise" or "another kingdom, which is represented by the silver parts of the statue, will arise" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_symlanguage]])

tn.ref: yet a third kingdom of bronze
tn.text: "yet kingdom number three, which is of bronze," or "then still another kingdom, which is represented by the bronze parts of the statue" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_symlanguage]])
Daniel continues talking to the king.

tn.ref: There will be a fourth kingdom
tn.text: "There will be a kingdom number four" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
The fourth kingdom is spoken of as being as strong as iron. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: It will shatter all these things and crush them
tn.text: This symbolic language means the fourth kingdom will defeat and replace the other kingdoms. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_symlanguage]])
"the previous kingdoms" (UDB)
Daniel continues talking to the king.
Nebuchadnezzar saw that the feet consisted of clay and iron. He did not see the process of making the feet.

tn.ref: were partly made of baked clay and partly made of iron
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "were a mixture of baked clay and iron" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"they will not remain united"
Daniel continues talking to the king.

tn.ref: In the days of those kings
tn.text: Here "those kings" refers to the rulers of the kingdoms symbolized by the different parts of the statue.

tn.ref: that will never be destroyed, nor will it be conquered by another people
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that no one will ever destroy, and that another people never conquer" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: a stone was cut out of the mountain, but not by human hands
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "someone cut a stone from the mountain, but it was not a human who cut it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
trustworthy and correct
This symbolic act showed that the king was honoring Daniel. AT: "lay down with his face on the ground" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])

tn.ref: an offering be made and that incense be offered up to him
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "his servants make an offering and offer up incense to Daniel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"It is true that your God"

tn.ref: the God of gods, the Lord of kings
tn.text: "greater than all the other gods, and King over all other kings" (UDB)
Translate "the one who reveals mysteries" as in [[:en:bible:notes:dan:02:29|2:29]].
"to reveal the mystery of my dream"
"The king made Daniel the ruler"
These were the Babylonian names of the three Jewish men who were brought to Babylon with Daniel. See how you translated these names in [[:en:bible:notes:dan:01:06|1:7]]
